flow.descriptionCdata:
6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.01f2f2e6-c044-406c-807d-bcafad6a8174.prompt=Component ID 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.061f2a3c-94ef-4337-b179-f6f1b2f7e7cc.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.13252f42-bc64-4f33-9193-e76ca01f03a3.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.1f58c327-348b-4f7c-a8de-073e92aa2439.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.22798a53-9a96-4225-82b6-94c73bc56da8.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.475d68bc-aa9f-405d-8ef8-559a3345eef0.prompt=Artifact ID 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.5225e046-81b7-4b9e-8830-eb91b2f43a30.prompt=Process Instance ID 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.5411c6a1-dba0-4396-ae07-fd08504ebc47.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.658c5a68-c316-4132-8edd-320270674d5e.prompt=Resource Provider ID 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.962c26ae-eca9-40d1-84c9-66bee9c1bcbd.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.a1016aae-8b50-40ad-9a12-cbae017f1157.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.a8646f10-8d5b-4131-a19c-7b515216118d.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.aec222b7-a6a8-4306-953c-b80fde6249a9.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.cc652b2d-35cc-4e2a-a9e5-1f98c6a29fef.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.d73c5671-e34e-4719-a111-f6577e3b1543.prompt=User Identifier 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.d8378aca-15ab-4f49-b23b-98d805acd1c3.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.description=
Suspend the Virtual Machine

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.e25d5563-d53c-4d1f-8823-73525f993e69.prompt=Process Instance ID 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.e926d3a1-613e-4013-9302-a2c2e3c1fe96.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 6ad8b41d-62b1-46e8-8eff-80f9033285ea.f7c454d7-2c4a-4a28-8f5b-aa66b4b4870c.prompt=Process Instance ID
flow.name: vCenter Suspend Server
